choices.A: It fails because archive log files cannot be backed up using a connection to a PDB.
choices.B: It succeeds but only the data files belonging to the pdb2_i pluggable database are backed up.
choices.D: It fails because the pluggable clause is missing.
choices.C: It succeeds and all data files belonging to PD32_i are backed up along with the archive log files.

questions.question_text:
Your multitenant container database (CDB) cdb1 that is running in archivelog mode contains two pluggable databases (PDBs), pdb2_1 and pdb2_2. RMAN is connected to the target database pdb2_1.
Examine the command executed to back up pdb2_1:
RMAN> BACKUP DATABASE PLUS ARCHIVELOG;
Which statement is true about the execution of this command?

choices.B: The procedure must be executed before creating any plan directive.
choices.D: The other_groups group is not included in the resource plan.
choices.C: The sys_group group is not included in the resource plan.
choices.A: The pending area is automatically submitted when creating plan directives.
choices.E: Pending areas can not be validated until submitted.

choices.C: Corrupted blocks in the data files are checked and repaired before performing the database backup.
choices.A: Corrupted blocks, if any, are repaired in the backup created.
choices.D: The database is checked for physically corrupt blocks and any corrupted blocks are repaired.
choices.B: Only those data files that have corrupted blocks are backed up.

questions.question_text:
You are connected to a pluggable database (PDB) as a common user with the sysdba privilege. The PDB is open and you issue the shutdown immediate command.
What is the outcome?

choices.B: The PDB is placed in mount state.
choices.D: The command results in an error because the PDB can be shut down only by a local user.
choices.C: The command executes only if the common user is granted the set container privilege for the PDB.

questions.question_text: Which three statements are true about the SQL*Loader utility?

choices.E: It can be used to generate unique sequential values in specified columns while loading data.
choices.A: It can be used to load data from multiple external files into multiple tables.
choices.C: It can be used to load data from external files using direct path only.
choices.D: It can be used to create tables using data that is stored in external files.
choices.B: It can be used to extract and reorganize data from external files, and then load it into a table.
